This game is a horror game but when you play with friends you start to forget that part. There are so many things added to this game from little details, to well planned details. You can play with so many characters and design your favorite characters. Its so fun to play with friends but its still really fun to play by yourself. You cant either be a killer or a survivor. I highly recommend this game if you like horror, escape, and semi hard games.
Makes me want to kill myself but I keep going back to it. 9/10

I have been playing the game for years. I am by no means a pro player at all, however i have only one had a break from this game and thats rare for me. Usually i get bored of games, but never this one. The hit boxes and other stuff where a problem but the creators do a decent job at fixing any issues that are brought to their attention. I love this game, and always will.

Game is made by a bunch of sexually frustrated "adults" with dysfunctional and small pp nrg. Don't get it unless it's on sale 80% off or better only get it for free. The only game that has a more broken matchmaking system than this is Apex and LoL. This game is fun to play about 2-3 hours once every two weeks. That's it. 

Edit : Devs are competing with Respawn to see which one is the most incompetent and mediocre company at ruining a great game with their imbecilistic matchmaking system. I am glad Epic Games gave this game for free, because in it's current state with the matchmaking, Befailure entertainment doesn't deserve a cent.

Let's not beat around the bush - the game has some glaring issues, such as balance and bugs. It often feels like the developers are prioritizing pumping out new content the keep the cash inflow uninterrupted instead of fixing the bugs and imbalances in the game. That being said, the game is still fun when you play with friends. The community tends to be quite toxic, especially survivors, but that's how it will always be. Few games have a non-toxic community anyways, because that's how humans are.

As far as asymmetrical PVP survival games go, this is pretty much the only game you should bother with as of right now.

Can't really believe I'm going to thumbs this down after playing this long, but my conclusion is that this game is for the most part, only viable long term to masochists, assholes and idiots.

To succeed by the game's standards, you have to play like an ass.  From either side-  It's a pissing contest of poorly implemented mechanics, mostly due in my opinion to the inclusion of the previous gen's console market, controller implementations, mediocre server stability, and the fact that the dev team has fallen into the pitfall of thinking cosmetics are content enough to keep a game healthy.  Also, I find the marketing of the game to be harmful to the actual gameplay- this is not a game to take very seriously.  It's a party game.  

There's plenty of fun to be had here, but to find it you'll either be grabbing your friends to bully some stranger (whom, more often than not, is some desperate and sad sack who is literally role playing a serial killer just to feel a bit of power/validation) or prepare to leverage people's altruism and greed against them in mind games that, while novel, ultimately aren't very compelling once everybody knows what's going on.  Once you've peeled back the outermost layer, this game is a "get off my lawn" simulator.  A type of freeze-jail tag. 

I found it to be a fantastic sociological experiment.  I learned things about myself- reaffirmed that I come to different conclusions than many given the same information.  I made friends, and like any game if you're playing it with the right people and treating it like it's supposed to be treated, it can be a good time.  Just ignore the setting, ignore the fact that the game is pushing you to actively frustrate one another and calling it competition- and actively focus on enjoying the kid's game of tag underneath.  Or don't buy it, like I'd ultimately recommend.
Wenn man in einer Gruppe mit Freunden spielt macht dieses Spiel sehr viel Spa√ü.

A maddening concept - repeatedly repairing generators to power doors, and then escape from said doors. All the while a psychopath is hunting you down with murderous zeal. But despite its rather repetitive feeling gameplay it remains one of my more played games on Steam. It is a fun experience that is only amplified if you are playing it with friends. You can either play solo online as a killer in an attempt to kill survivors and prevent their escape, or you can play solo or with up to three friends (four players in total) as a survivor online in an attempt to avoid the killer, power the generators, and escape. There is also a "Custom Games" mode where you can play with up to four friends (five players in total) where one player plays the killer and up to four play survivors.

The game itself is great and tons of fun. However, a lot of matches are ruined by the horrendous match-making system, that doesn't take into account true player skill and gives you unfair matches especially as a solo queue survivor. A skill rating system is in the works however there is no mention of when it will be released.
I'm old and addicted to this damn game.
